name: Evason Hua Hin

reviews.title: A Wonderful place but no beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hua Hin might not be most genuine place in Thailand. There is no beach during the day (because of the tide) and the town is pretty dull, although modern, from my point of view. However, they got most sunny days in Thailand which is great advantage. Six Senses Hideaway is located about 30 minutes south of Hua Hin, but it doesn’t matter. There is no need to leave this beautiful resort. I have previously stayed with Six Senses Hideaway on Koh Samui (and went there again this time after Hua Hin) and I just love Six Senses for their quality, beautiful design, breathtaking environments and outstanding service. The villas are large and very comfortable with everything you can ask for. Gorgeous outdoor sala, pool area and garden with its lotus ponds. Large bedroom, indoor and outdoor shower plus a floating outdoor bathtub in the lotus pond. The décor is simple, yet beautiful, well maintained and genuine. All modern facilities such as large flat screen TV, DVD, stereo with outdoor speakers, free wifi and tea/coffee making facilities. Plenty of complimentary drinking water replenished morning and evening. Six Senses is an eco friendly resort which shows in both design and function. However, as a guest no comfort has been spared, just carefully well-considered. Here in Hua Hin Six Senses Hideaway share some of the facilities, such as the large beautiful pool, with their sister hotel Six Senses Evason. Although both separated resorts link together and are equally beautiful, I think the Hideaway side offers more privacy, comfort, luxury and personal service. For instance, here each villa comes with a pool and has butler service. The outstanding breakfast is partly à la carte. Hideway side is smaller and more intimate. However, both resorts jointly offer excellent dining opportunities (Italian, Thai, Tapas, Gourmet and weekly buffets), a nice bar with live music and 2 different Spas. Try the Chef’s dinner; it’s really enjoyable in a different atmosphere!
reviews.title: Great villa - disappointing food and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Few negative issues though: No beach (as mentioned) and there is a road between the sea and the resort (pool area) with some traffic (not a lot). At the pool they don’t have free drinking water and the resort is away from any stores or shopping. Furthermore would not recommend villas situated on the side of the resort (facing north) as the view (outside of the resort) is not so pretty and they don’t offer much sun during the day.
reviews.title: Perfect and very good service
A lovely hideaway well worth discovering
reviews.text: Conclusion: I prefer the Hideaway location in Koh Samui, but my expectations were not let down here in Hua Hin! It’s a resort which I would recommend and certainly return to!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traveled to the Evason in Hua Hin for Chinese New Year from Hong Kong. We had reserved a regular pool villa, but ended up deciding to upgrade to one of the Hideaway Pool Villas which was a FAR nicer room, for an extra 4,000 baht per night. The villa was absolutely gorgeous (we stayed in number 31) with a really decent sized pool and plenty of shady areas for lounging. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom facilities were great. We brought very limited clothes and toiletries, but found the Evason was able to supply everything we needed.
reviews.title: Absolutely Brilliant- Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had been staying at the villa no. 27 from 4 to 7 Oct 2011 before heading back to Bangkok.
reviews.title: An absolute feeling of Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The overall impression of the villa was very good and the facilities inside it were all well maintained. The breakfast in the Living Room was great but we found that there were more choices in the Beach Restaurant. It was worth spending a little walk from our villa to there.
reviews.title: Perfect stay, perfect service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends

She did her job very well !
reviews.title: Nice place from city escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym was small but good. Our room was the fairly basic studio one, but still immaculate, with a veranda with a day bed and table/chairs. They give you special stuff to keep the mosquitos at bay and free water every day. There was no problem with insects.
reviews.title: Brilliant! :-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: We ate in the Italian restaurant. The best dish was the crab cakes with avocado salad which is the most delicious thing imaginable!
reviews.title: The evason was not in Hua Hin, actually in Pranburi. Don't make confusion where real location resort is?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The pool area is fabulous with a view of the beach and great poolside service. A lot of people complain about the narrow road between the hotel pool and the beach, but this was not a problem for me. It was fairly quiet, just mostly locals flying by on their scooters.
reviews.title: Blissful visit with fantastic service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The downsides? Not much. The beach isn't good because although the water is warm, it is not clear and is full of jellyfish (we were there in September). They are pretty to look at though.
reviews.title: evason six senses spa
A fantastic honeymoon destination- really friendly at the Bamboo Beach Bar!
reviews.text: Stayed at the Evason in a pool villa for our honeymoon- absolutely amazing- lovely private plunge pool and daybeds wre fab! The food in the hotel was superb - well worth the money - we got 3 complimentary meals as part of our stay- by far the best was the Six senses restaurant with the sunken salas!! but the thai restaurant was also great with shows on 2 nights a week. We also had a private barbeque by our pool and felt like royalty- I'd definitely recommend splashing out the extra cash to so this if you can. the massages in the spa were lovely -but if you don't need the holistic atmosphere you can have a great one for 90 mins on thr beachside for about £2.50!! (I did every day!!)Our butler Joy couldn't do enough for us- even cold drinks and towels left when we came back from excursions. The restaurants alaong the beach however are about atenth of the price is not less and the food was gorgeous- if you don't want the luxurios atmosphere of the hotel and the Bamboo Beach Bar was great for a few drinks- Jane - the owner was so friendly and helpful- even arranging bikes for us to fish resaurants a bit further- well worth a visit! We're so glad we stayed here rather than in hua Hin itself.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent 7 nights in a pool villa at the hotel in May 2009. We can honestly say that this was one of the best holidays we have had as the location, hotel itself, pools, accomadation, restaurants and food where all incredible. We would also recommend staying in a pool villa if possible. We were given the chance to upgrade to the hideaway resort which is attached to six senses - however we felt that the pool villa was better than what was on offer in the Hideaway section and stayed put. As all the other reviews point out that Sings bar is just a short walk down the dirt road that runs across the frontage of the hotel. The drinks here are cheaper than at the hotel and this is a great place to watch the sunset. Sing can also arrange transport and excursions through his friend Mr Moo. We would recommend the quad tour and the half day jet ski tour from Mr Moo. We would definately stay here again and lok forward to doing so in the future.
reviews.title: Gorgeous resort - A+

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like Thailand then you will just love Six Senses Hideaway in Hua Hin. Its the essence of tranquillity. Just relax in your private pool side villa and enjoy.
reviews.title: Six'th Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service is exquisite, attentive but not intrusive. The food is maimly Thai, so its spicy but they will temper this upon request. In fact there is liitle they will not try and help with when asked.
reviews.title: Relaxing Hideaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes its expensive but well worth it for a romantic get away. and if you need to watch the pennies on the xtra just remember that a one and halh hour Thai oil massage out sider the resoort costs $7.50 and is every bit as good as the spa treatment insider the resort, but the surroundings are down market - you feel like a boneless chicken after one!
reviews.title: Just what we needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the previous comments are very valid - nice accommodation and very private pool and sala area, good food at the restaurants (but disappointing that the Thai restaurant was shut for 2 out of our 4 nights at the resort).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: And full marks for noticing that my wife's birthday coincided with our stay, and the delicious cake that arrived in the morning.
reviews.title: Can't be faulted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where the hotel does unfortunately miss out is in not having a proper beach. The little that there is was completely covered by water throughout our stay as high tide was during the daytime. So that just left the swimming pool area (which is communal with the adjacent Evason Hotel, part of the same group). Too many people smoking, kids running round, and the sight of traffic on the local road between the hotel and the beachside made this a less than luxurious experience.
reviews.title: Chilled out bliss!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're wondering how to get to Hua Hin and want to be a bit adventurous, then take the train from Bangkok - a great 4 hour ride in 2nd class costs just £3, then a 30 minute taxi journey for about £10 to the resort - you're ready for the Six Senses luxury by then!
reviews.title: A fantastic peacful and relaxing place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This morning we had a gourmet breakfast in a sunken sala with a lily pond surrounding us, followed by a bicycle ride to a local village. Back to the hotel for a swim and a drink and then an amazing dinner at a beach shack this evening. Haven't even tried the spa yet! We'll be back!
reviews.title: Stay in a villa or forget it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I found this little gem when we were looking for somewhere to celebrate my 25thx2 birthday and our 10 year anniversary. It looked magnificent on the web site, but you really don't know until you get there. Well.......it was even better in real life. The first thing that we found daunting was the trip by car..3 hours at horrendous speeds in torrential rain on roads with no apparent road rules or speed limit. In future, we will either take the train or the light plane......although we had a brilliant driver on the return trip, it still took 4 and a half hours, which is not a good start to a long trip home! Other than that our holiday was without fault.
reviews.title: "Can't wait to go back next year!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Because we arrived after midnight on our 1st day, we were kind of iffy about the place, it was hot, humid and we were very tired (not to mention in a state of shock!!!!) and because it is an Eco friendly resort, most of the outside lighting is candlelight. However, our studio room was lovely and cold, and although a little damp in places, due to the humidity, we absolutely loved it.
reviews.title: Relaxing, but a few things to note....
This was really different!
reviews.text: When we ventured out the next morning to the most amazing buffet breakfast, (if you stayed 6 months, I don't think you could eat all that is on offer!!!) we were amazed at the beauty of the place. Lily ponds everywhere, friendly, smiling staff always ready with a sa-wad-dee-kha! Ponds surrounding toilets! A huge pool with sun beds all around, a wonderful (albeit the only) bar facing the sea and the road, which we found to be an endless source of fascination and didn't bother us in the slightest. In fact, we are still humming the tunes from the Thai ice-cream vendors bikes!!!! At night, upstairs in the bar, there was live entertainment in the form of a lovely Thai girl called Pamela, who was a great singer, her rendition of 'Land down under' should be our new national anthem!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A little known restaurant was the Dining Room, with sunken booths surrounded by lily ponds and candlelight..one night my husband and I were the only ones there, it was lovely. Called the Hideaway. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Perfect to Relax and do Nothing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple

If you want snorkeling, or any other activity, such as trekking, kayaking, jet skis, trips to temples or elephant rides, it is all available and the staff are more than happy to organise it all for you.

description: Hua Hin is approximately 230 kilometres or 140 miles south of Bangkok. An excellent highway provides for a three-hour drive. King Rama VII built a palace there in 1926 and it remains the Thai Royal family Summer Palace to this day. Evason Hua Hin is located in the quiet area of Pranburi, south of Hua Hin Township. Set amongst 8 hectares or 20 acres of gardens, facing the Gulf of Siam, it offers 185 guest accommodations in a garden setting, including 40 private pool villas each measuring 110 square metres. Evason Studios feature an oversized terrace complete with a daybed. Guestrooms offer eco-friendly designs adhering to a renowned responsibility to the environment and the Evason philosophy of Redefining Experiences. Dining options include The Restaurant serving a daily International breakfast buffet, while Kieng Sah restaurant features authentic Thai cuisine. The Beach is open daily for lunch and dinner and serves Mediterranean cuisine with a strong Italian influence. The Bar is located adjacent to the main pool and offers an all day drinks and dining option serving a comprehensive range of wines and cocktails along with traditional international and Asian favourites. The Earth Spa presents a truly relaxing and revitalizing experience with therapeutic and pampering treatments to balance the senses. Just Kids! has its own swimming pool and keeps children entertained all day, and at night offers evening sleepovers with professional supervision.Free wifi is available in all public areas throughout the property.
